tasks.subject: DNL SVT
tasks.description:
Activity # 4 – Pythagoras and music

Some sounds are harmonious to our ears while other are dissonant. 

 Problem to solve : What is the origin of this difference ?

Before watching the video : look for the correspondance between the notes used in latin countries and the notes used in anglo-saxon countries.

 

 

Watch the video at the following link : https://youtu.be/H6NtcWkGh50

And answer the questions :

1 / Who was Pythagoras ? When and where did he live ?

 

2 / What is the difference between the ratios of harmonious sounds and dissonant sounds ?

 

3/ What is an octave ?  What is the frequency ratio between notes separated by an octave ?

 

4/ What is the ratio of a perfect fifth ? (= une quinte juste)

 

5/ What is the ratio of a perfect fourth ?(= quarte juste)

 

6/ What is the ratio of a third majeur? (= tierce major)

tasks.subject: DNL SVT
tasks.description:
- Correction of assignment # 1
- Assignment #2 : préparation of our future experiments :

Introduction

Along with our exploration of sound properties and our perception of sound, we will prepare our experiments of plant and music.

Our goals :

Plants grow better with music : Science or myth ?

+ Look for information (Ex : growth of tomatoes using music)

+ Choose a classical music (Ex : Gnossienne n° 1 – Erik satie)

+  Design a protocole : We will use lentil seeds

 

Do individual plant have their own electrical patterns and consequently musical patterns? What is the impact of plant interaction on that pattern (presentation of an experiment)
